title: Webdesign / Interactive Marketing Company
content:
Hello,

The name is Viviré which in Spanish translates to “I will live”. I can go forever on why that is the name, but to make it short..we started using the name to evoke a sense of passion or attitude in business.

I attached the original logo which was designed by me more than 5 years ago without any reasoning or strategic thinking.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806185547im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_old.gif)

We want a logo that make us look like leaders in design and strategy.

Here are a few rough concepts. I would like to keep posting reviews on this thread and document the revision process.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806185547im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_vivire.gif)

Let me know what you guys think. Right now we don’t have an established preferance for colors, types, etc.

Many thanks,

Edgardo

 [‹ Deseos Hookah Bar logo](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806185547/http:/typophile.com/node/21468 "Go to previous forum topic") [Skate Shop Logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806185547/http:/typophile.com/node/27313 "Go to next forum topic")
author: vivirenet

comments.content:
At the moment 2 is the one showing some promise although I am not convinced about the positioning of the type and cone symbol (what does that represent?), a more congenial position might be between the i’s, I think you should look at other typefaces, although removing the dots from the i’s is working I don’t think removing the accent is necessarily a good idea.  
Tim

Tim,

Thanks for your reply. I think we will add the accent. In terms of the cone, the designer wante to convey communication and keep a reference to the ’v’. What do you think about the icon on 3? I am leaning to transparecy to convey a modern feel.

Edgardo

I dont like transparency much, it was trendy 2 or 3 years ago.  
Your name viviré sounds beautiful and is concisely. Therefore: I dont know if you really need an icon!? Try to make a logo just with typography and maybe try to personalise the type a bit like you have done it in version 2.

Greetings: Steven

(just my opinion)
try using an infintity symbol. I will live (forever)

Hi,

I am back. Wow! We left this project untouched back in March. We developed a new concept we are happy with, keeping yellow as the main color.

Let me know what you think.

Thanks,

E.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806185547im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Imagen%208(4)_4149.PNG)

Since the last post we made some changes to the v’s. We felt that by ’opening’ more the v’s the logo gets more balanced.

Any comments?.....anyone?

E.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070806185547im_/http:/typophile.com/files/logo_changes_6082.jpg)

The flat bottom of the e is bothering me, I feel it should start flattening out further to the right. I think the wider v’s are unbalancing the colour of the logo rather than balancing, it starts off light and gets dark as it goes along, the notch of the v image is also quite heavy.  
Tim
